poem:
"Harbinger of Silence"

Like a paper boat on a digital sea,
Meta withstands the storm bravely so.
No quid pro quo between thee and me,
An Albanese tune fades in echo.
News, a silenced reel, to stop, unfold -
A blank canvas for history untold.
When the tab closes, does the conversation end,
Or signals a new tale we've yet to comprehend?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Meta on collision course with Australian government after announcing end to journalism funding deals Facebook and Instagram’s parent company, Meta, has set itself on a collision course with the Albanese government after announcing it will stop paying Australian publishers for news, and plans to shut down its news tab in Australia and the United States. Meta informed publishers on Friday that it would not enter new deals when the current contracts expire this year. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Meta on collision course with Australian government after announcing end to journalism funding deals Facebook and Instagram’s parent company, Meta, has set itself on a collision course with the Albanese government after announcing it will stop paying Australian publishers for news, and plans to shut down its news tab in Australia and the United States. Meta informed publishers on Friday that it would not enter new deals when the current contracts expire this year. The
